summary: viewer crash in llassert(mcurrentdiscardlevel when changing draw distance
description: repro launch viewer and log in move to your avatar to a place on the edge of the region where you get a good view of the nearby region open the pref panel go to the graphic tab click advanced increase the draw distance from to for instance click ok the view crash while redrawing the nearby stuff that are now coming into view expected no reason the code reaches llassert(mcurrentdiscardlevel and crashes the invalid texture should be tested upstream and handled adequately i think
issue when changing the draw distance llviewerwindow::restartdisplay is called which eventually calls restoregl which iterates on all textures

the code void for iter simagelist.begin iter simagelist.end iter llimagegl glimage iter llerrs tex name is not llendl if true null deletes data the problem is that some of the textures are not valid and have an mcurrentdiscardlevel when creategltexture is called on the first of those textures this leads to the assert and as expected crashes the app

summary: as a developer i want to create a performance data tracking system so i can get a baseline of current performance before switching to a new lib
description: before embarking into switching to a new lib we need to get a baseline of the current performance so we can assess improvement
there is such a system in newview/llmetricperformancetester.h and cpp but it needs to be moved to llcommon generalized and publicly documented
test plan please refer to the wiki for more details on how to run perf metric with the new system

here is a simple yet efficient test plan that runs through all the code written test framework and specific image compression/decompression test follow the simple method here under using a terminal window navigate to the directory where the viewer executable is located
note that on mac that means you need to navigate inside the second life.app folder the bundle to the second subfolder
first gather baseline data launching the viewer with the following arguments

for mac os x life logmetrics imagecompressiontester while the app is running browse around choose a region with lots of textures and take a couple of snapshots of that you choose to upload so to exercise the compressor quit the viewer navigate to the log folder and verify that it contains a imagecompressiontester.slp file rename that file imagecompressiontester_baseline.slp go back to the terminal window and relaunch the viewer with the following arguments

again example for mac life logmetrics imagecompressiontester analyzeperformance go through the same browsing and snapshots taking scenario quit the viewer navigate to the log folder and verify that it contains a new imagecompressiontester.slp file as well as an imagecompressiontester_report.csv file open imagecompressiontester_report.csv you can use openoffice for this verify that it contains the result of the test it compares baseline and current run if time allows redo the whole here above tests using the following values instead of imagecompressiontester texturetester this will output bao's texture analysis perf data metric this will output both texturetester and imagecompressiontester in one single metric report

summary: fixed sky settings do not return correct sun position
description: the server sends the time to the viewer expressed as a sun angle in radians
the same value in vector form can be read by scripts using llgetsundirection

a related value can also be read using llgettimeofday though the documentation on just what to expect from that is much less clear it does say second life days cycles are hours long hours of light hour of the sunrise and sunset time varies slowly
this does have an implication for us

it turns out that there's a difference between a region set to have a fixed time of day previously set in the floater estate tab and one that just has a fixed sky the phase control from that dialog causes the two lsl functions above to behave differently

when the region is set to a fixed sun that causes the llgetsundirection to always return that fixed value rather than one dependent on the time it also seems to change llgettimeofday but in a less clear our current implementation will break that since we are never setting the fixed sun flag

there's an awkward disconnect in the old functionality the estate time phase on a fixed sun region controlled what llgetsundirection returned but that had no relationship to the sun angle in the windlight sky preset selected
it was possible to set the estate phase to one value and then set the apparent position of the sun to something else in the sky preset
if the estate manager did that under the old controls the llgetsundirection would return a value that didn't match what the user saw
i suspect this came about because there used to be just the one control for the region time but when windlight sky presets were created they added an independent control

i think the correct solution to reconcile this is for us to change the code so that if the estate manager selects a fixed sky in the environment tab then we tell the sim that it is a fixed sun region but instead of having a phase control there we extract the sun position from the selected sky preset
this will ensure that the llgetsundirection will return a value that points to the apparent sun in any fixed sky region

in regions set to use a day cycle the sun position in each selected sky preset will control the apparent position those will only match what llgetsundirection returns if the user who created the sky and day cycle presets did so in a way that approximates the underlying sl time of day but i don't think there's anything we can or should do about that

summary: design enable use region environment settings by default
description: oz wolf and i discussed this yesterday
use region environment settings should be on by default because seamless and simple

a main goal of this project is to increase immersion by ensuring residents are having a shared most new residents will have absolutely no idea about this control unless they are specifically this of course is magnified by basic mode which allow someone to change the time of day at all they simply enter a region and see whatever set to
so enabling use region environment settings including in basic mode is really a consistent extension of existing behavior which shows the time of day at a default day cycle
a newcomer would be very confused if friends keep referring to look at the crazy yellow sky and all they see is the default blue one
even if told most new resis care by the time they do advanced to a savvy enough level with the confidence to make their own decisions
note that customizing windlight is often paired with exploration photography both of those which have their own intricacies and presume that the user is reasonably advanced
anyone can at any time by unchecking this box guided with a little education
note that if someone unchecks use region environment settings it should persist and stay off across sessions
it would be annoying to have it keep popping back such as if a photographer who keeps crashing a fairly common scenario given snapshot in other words always remember last state set by user

summary: llimage_libtest does not build on linux
description: this tool does not currently build on linux using autobuild

some strange messages show up saying warning file not returning type other possibly incorrect this is due to the recursive dependency machinery in some of the libs required for llimage_libtest to depend on other libs and that recursive search apparently fails on symbolic links
when that happens a not found message is emitted fed through and give us this absurd error message and failure
the proper way of fixing this is to modify the cmake scripts in getprerequisites.cmake so that it does behave correctly with symbolic links
also one should audit the lib dependencies as clearly no reason to pull more than listed in the llimage_libtest cmake

summary: design and implement a customized memory management system
description: design a customized memory management system similar like but it is faster and more that is each application can have its own dedicated memory pools for every purpose
the goal is to apply local memory boundary limits to each application so the fragmentation problem is restricted in local
we also design special allocation/deallocation strategy to minimize local fragmentation problem
the difference of this memory system from is a global system while this is a local dedicated system
this system is not intended to replace rather it is to overcome global fragmentation problems caused by global malloc

summary: changing between view display names on and off during a conference call session put viewer in a state where last name resident was shown in viewer everywhere for user in conference call with last name resident
description: note this happened twice on different machines during testing of conference call changes on identity_evolution region on mohini
however i could not find a solid repro
i am listing some of the steps and things i found to discuss with leyla
here are steps i had documented when this occurred
however after documenting this i could not follow these same steps to repro
user a was on mac kurtland tester second life user b was on pc buffy second life user b started a conference call that included user a had view display names enabled
while active in the conference call user a disabled view display names
closed the conference call
had user b start another conference call including user a

on user a's computer user b's name included resident everywhere in the viewer buffy resident friends list notifications payments other users with last name resident did not show resident worked correctly
with the viewer in this state i toggled view display names on and off and that did not remove last name resident when view display names disabled
i opened the current release viewer on the same computer and buffy resident was shown everywhere
i deleted the entire secondlife user directory and buffy resident was still present

i located the name.cache file in and noticed the buffy resident was not present in name.cache file other names were i manually added buffy resident with appropriate agent id to the name.cache file when i added this name the viewer started to work correct to not show resident for buffy resident
i again removed the entire secondlife user directory and all the cache files and the issue remained buffy resident was shown everywhere
i logged into this same account kurtland tester on another machine during this time and the account worked correctly to not show last name resident for buffy resident
from my mac i removed everything i could think of related to secondlife downloaded a different build of second life and logged in and got same result buffy resident
gave up for a few hours came back and while doing some other testing i noticed it had corrected itself and kurtland tester was not showing last name resident for buffy
this was after about hours and seemed to clear itself on both of the mac machines that this occurred on
i do know if something else i did while testing corrected this or if a cache i did not touch expired fixing the issue

summary: make it possible to wear partial outfits
description: user story i have over outfits many of which are full prim avatars and do not and need not have a full repertoire of wearables

in using the new beta i have discovered that replace outfit is disabled for these components and when i attempt to strip down to a bare avatar and wear the outfit i wear shape and the like with add to outfit this is confusing and counterintuitive and not just for people like me with many existing outfits far too many to handle via the new outfit scheme but even worse a huge problem for people selling avatars because going to be impossible for customers to just buy and wear an avatar from inventory or by dragging the folder onto their nametag
they will have to remove everything currently wearing add the avatar then add the skin and shape
or else every avatar maker will have to rebox all their avatars with dummy to reproduce purchase a tiny avatar and attempt to use it
proposed fixes three options add an option in preferences that will both a
replace outfit for incomplete outfits
b
wear all items in a folder when adding to an avatar
add a modifier eg holding down a shift key when dragging to an avatar or clicking the menu button that will perform both these actions
simply back out the changes that led to this
been asked to add this in discussion in sl edit clarify proposed fixes code review request

summary: please allow adjustable transparency of nearby chat window chat history and chat toasts in viewer
description: many of us have a lot of text chat traffic to deal with
previously we were able to set the transparency of our chat windows
this allows us to keep an eye on chat without completely obscuring the world
when managing community areas this is very important

chat bubbles are allowed to be adjusted in transparency in viewer we should be able to adjust the transparency of the chat toasts and the nearby chat window as well like in viewer and similar to the chat bubble opacity
please allow this to happen
this is my major hinderance in using viewer right now
chat and chat history simply obscures too much of the screen and should be allowed to have an adjustable opacity
it can be ganged to bubble chat opacity if desired

edit and update many in comments have expressed that this ability for inactive/backgrounded windows to be transparent or to be able to set opacity of windows should not only be limited to the chat windows but all possibly obscuring windows such as script editor object properties and essentially all floaters when they do not have backgrounded

the lack of transparency in these windows something that was available on previous versions quite comprehensively for most windows that would get in the way cause this ui to be far more invasive than past iterations
note that many modern uis such as windows os x trillian astra etc use transparency to cause less obscuration and impact to the user
in a virtual world this is even more important than on the desktop however as awareness of the world behind the ui is not only important but is likely the main focus of the interaction
window transparency/adjustable opacity is a sorely needed aide to usability and accessibility of the sl world
it is not liklely to cause any further confusion to new residents as it is a paradigm that most operating systems already use
it does however keep the ui from being as much of an obstacle or barrier between the user and the world
and that seems to have been left behind in the redesign

summary: wearing different clothing layers at the same time pushes the inventory into an inconsistent state
description: wearing different clothing layers at the same time and for the first time after a cache clearing will produce very weird effects

what happens is that you wear the clothes everything seems normal then when you try to remove them you notice that one of them is stuck you remove it until you wear something else anything else not necessarily the same layer to force the avatar to rebake
to repro clear your cache
this is very important because subsequent tries with the same clothes allow you to repro the bug
select pieces of clothing at the same time in the same folder on each with shift pressed on one of them in the inventory then choose wear wait for the clothes to appear

keep them both selected on them then choose take off expected the clothes are both removed observed one of them stays and you remove it easily further observations the wearing tab of the outfits panel will not show the rogue piece of clothing as worn anymore but the my inventory tab will
there is no inventory loss observed things go back to normal when you manage to remove the rogue piece of clothing
it does that only the first time you wear a piece of clothing after clearing the cache
it will work the next times
if you want to repro the bug again without clearing your cache you need to choose other pieces of clothing

i have observed in sg build that llagentwearables::pushwearable will be called times the first time you wear layers of clothing it should be called once per layer and that when trying to remove the rogue clothing the method llagentwearables::getwearableindex will return by default because it does not find it should return to otherwise likely since clothing is not enabled in the viewer been banging my head over this bug for days now and this really cripples my ability to release a new rlv i will keep banging until either the bug or my head cracks
marine

summary: set cachelocation command does not work
description: user story as a user who launches second life using a script/shortcut to supply arguments i would expect that set cachelocation would be usable to change the cache location that second life uses
steps to reproduce create a shell script something like for os x you may need to create the cache folder first not sure if sl creates folders
run your script
expected results second life should use the cache folder located at desktop/testcache in preference to any other

observed results instead it will use the default cache folder or any location provided by notes i set this to major as severe seemed a bit much even though it appears to be the most valid based on the descriptions given there is no realistic workaround for this other than to manually enter the correct cache location in settings.xml however this feasible if you wish to use a volatile location whose name may change for example a temporary folder or a ram the only other is to actually have your script edit the settings xml file automatically which is a pretty nasty workaround other settings that tried with the set command appear to be fine including cachesize so it appears that cachelocation is the only one that work however it is one of the more desirable settings to change by command line i should also note that the whole is pretty messed up these days has been open practically forever and yet still sl silently quits if a new version or license agreement is detected instead of presenting the appropriate is a serious bug that renders the client largely unusable for most editing tasks when using the login parameter
having a developer overhaul the command line in viewer might be a good idea
